{{cpp/chrono/year_month_weekday_last/title|ok}}
{{cpp/chrono/year_month_weekday_last/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|since=c++20|
constexpr bool ok() const noexcept;
}}
{{dcl end}}
Checks if this object represents a valid date. Since a {{tt|year_month_weekday_last}} represents the last weekday of a particular month, it is valid as long as the year, month and weekday are valid.

===Return value===
{{c|year().ok() &amp;&amp; month().ok() &amp;&amp; weekday().ok()}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cassert&gt;
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
using namespace std::chrono;

int main()
{
    auto ymwdl{Tuesday[last]/11/2020};
    assert(ymwdl.ok());
    ymwdl = Tuesday[last]/-2/2021;
    assert(!ymwdl.ok());
    ymwdl += months(0); // Normalize month
    assert(ymwdl.ok());
}
}}
